Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US expresses a sense of entitlement to sit in judgement of murders - "crossing live into the moral world" by dragging the attorney before court. The Dutch react with a homily on the vagaries of life and with incredulity at the weirdly foreign notion that privileged first-world opinions need be entertained.

That is something that I have not done since - I have never fallen asleep at a real movie in a theater..even the worst movie.
